poem:
A Claim in Clacton  

Advice given, taken,  
retracted: a leaf on  
the cusp of change.  
Truth wavers like  
a whisper in wind,  
unfurls in a  
storm of voices.  
Where the heart  
of dialogue beats,  
the echo of  
words hangs,  
confused yet  
persistent, like  
an unscheduled  
meeting of minds,  
hoping to convene.
